info.description: This is the Anchore Engine API. Provides the primary external API for users of the service.
info.title: Anchore Engine API Server

200.description: Version check response, returns the api version prefix (e.g. 'v1')

get.description: Simple status check

get.summary: List the account for the authenticated user

parameters.description: Filter accounts by state
parameters.name: state

get.summary: List user summaries. Only available to the system admin user.

409.description: Conflicting user information. User already exists.

post.summary: Create a new user. Only avaialble to admin user.

delete.summary: Delete the specified account, only allowed if the account is in the disabled state. All users will be deleted along with the account and all resources will be garbage collected

get.summary: Get info about an user. Only available to admin user. Uses the main user Id, not a username.

400.description: State requested is invalid based on current state of the account

put.summary: Update the state of an account to either enabled or disabled. For deletion use the DELETE route

delete.summary: Delete a specific user credential by username of the credential. Cannot be the credential used to authenticate the request.

get.summary: Get a specific user in the specified account

400.description: Conflict, cannot delete the credential used to authenticate this request

200.description: Add a credential, overwritting if already exists

500.description: Internal server error processing the request. Retry expected

delete.description: Delete the groups and data for the feed and disable the feed itself

put.description: Disable the feed so that it does not sync on subsequent sync operations

delete.description: Delete the group data and disable the group itself

parameters.description: The Webhook Type that we should test
parameters.name: webhook_type

parameters.description: What kind of Notification to send
parameters.name: notification_type

200.description: The Webhook was sent successfully. Schemas may be found under Models (PolicyEvalNotification, TagUpdateNotification, VulnUpdateNotification, AnalysisUpdateNotification)

400.description: The Webhook failed to send due to misconfiguration

500.description: The Webhook failed to send due to an Internal Error

post.description: Loads the Webhook configuration for webhook_type, and sends the notification out as a test
post.summary: Adds the capabilities to test a webhook delivery for the given notification type

200.description: Add a credential, overwritting if already exists

get.description: Returns the version object for the service, including db schema version info

AccessCredential.description: A login credential mapped to a user identity. For password credentials, the username to present for Basic auth is the user's username from the user record

created_at.description: The timestamp of creation of the credential
The timestamp when the account was created

email.description: Optional email address associated with the account

last_updated.description: The timestamp of the last update to the account metadata itself (not users or creds)

name.description: The account identifier, not updatable after creation

state.description: State of the account. Disabled accounts prevent member users from logging in, deleting accounts are disabled and pending deletion and will be removed once all owned resources are garbage collected by the system

type.description: The user type (admin vs user). If not specified in a POST request, 'user' is default

AccountCreationRequest.description: An account to create/add to the system. If already exists will return 400.

email.description: An optional email to associate with the account for contact purposes

name.description: The account name to use. This will identify the account and must be globally unique in the system.

AddAnalysisArchiveResult.description: List of analysis archive add results

AnalysisArchiveAddResult.description: The result of adding a single digest to the archive

detail.description: Details on the status, e.g. the error message

digest.description: The image digest requested to be added

status.description: The status of the archive add operation. Typically either 'archived' or 'error'

AnalysisArchiveRules.description: Rule set for automatic archiving of system objects and flushing of archived objects (permament delete).

AnalysisArchiveRulesSummary.description: Summary of the transition rule set

count.description: The number of rules for this account

last_updated.description: The newest last_updated timestamp from the set of rules

AnalysisArchiveSource.description: An image reference in the analysis archive for the purposes of loading analysis from the archive into th working set

digest.description: The image digest identify the analysis. Archived analyses are based on digest, tag records are restored as analysis is restored.

AnalysisArchiveSummary.description: A summarization of the analysis archive, including size, counts, etc. This archive stores image analysis only, never the actual image content or layers.

last_updated.description: The timestamp of the most recent archived image

total_data_bytes.description: The total sum of all the bytes stored to the backing storage. Accounts for anchore-applied compression, but not compression by the underlying storage system.

total_image_count.description: The number of unique images (digests) in the archive

total_tag_count.description: The number of tag records (registry/repo:tag pull strings) in the archive. This may include repeated tags but will always have a unique tag->digest mapping per record.

AnalysisArchiveTransitionHistory.description: A rule for auto-archiving image analysis by time and/or tag-history

transition_task_id.description: The task that created & updated this entry

AnalysisArchiveTransitionRule.description: A rule for auto-archiving image analysis by time and/or tag-history

analysis_age_days.description: Matches if the analysis is strictly older than this number of days

max_images_per_account.description: This is the maximum number of image analyses an account can have. Can only be set on system_global rules

system_global.description: True if the rule applies to all accounts in the system. This is only available to admin users to update/modify, but all users with permission to list rules can see them

tag_versions_newer.description: Number of images mapped to the tag that are newer

transition.description: The type of transition to make. If "archive", then archive an image from the working set and remove it from the working set. If "delete", then match against archived images and delete from the archive if match.

AnalysisArchiveTransitionRuleExclude.description: Which Images to exclude from auto-archiving logic

expiration_days.description: How long the image selected will be excluded from the archive transition

AnalysisUpdateEval.description: Evaluation Results for an entity (current or last)

allOf.description: The Notification Object definition for Tag Update Notifications

AnchoreErrorCode.description: A description of an anchore error code (name, description)

AnchoreImage.description: A unique image in the engine. May have multiple tags or references. Unique to an image content across registries or repositories.

analysis_status.description: A state value for the current status of the analysis progress of the image

image_detail.description: Details specific to an image reference and type such as tag and image source

AnchoreImageTagSummary.description: A unique image in the engine.

detail.description: Details structure for additional information about the error if available. Content and structure will be error specific.

ArchiveSummary.description: A summarization of the available archives, a place to for long-term storage of audit, analysis, or other data to remove it from the system's working set but keep it available.

annotations.description: User provided annotations as key-value pairs

archive_size_bytes.description: The size, in bytes, of the analysis archive file

imageDigest.description: The image digest (digest of the manifest describing the image, per docker spec)

image_detail.description: List of tags associated with the image digest

parentDigest.description: The digest of a parent manifest (for manifest-list images)

BaseNotificationData.description: Every notification has a payload, which follows this basic structure

ContentJAVAPackageResponse.description: Java package content listings from images

content.description: List of malware scan results, one per scanner configured to run

license.description: Deprecated in favor of the 'licenses' field"

ContentResponse.description: Generic wrapper for content listings from images

DeleteImageResponse.description: Image deletion response containing status and details

status.description: Current status of the image deletion

DeleteImageResponseList.description: A list of delete image responses

EventDescription.description: A description of an event type

message.description: The message associated with the event type

name.description: The event type. The last component of the fully-qualified event_type (category.subcategory.event)

resource_type.description: The type of resource this event is generated from

type.description: The fully qualified event type as would be seen in the event payload

EventResponse.description: A record of occurance of an asynchronous event triggered either by system or by user activity

EventSubcategory.description: A collection of events related to each other

EventsList.description: Response envelope for paginated listing of events

item_count.description: Number of events in this page

next_page.description: Boolean flag, True indicates there are more events and False otherwise

page.description: Page number of this result set

FeedMetadata.description: Metadata on a single feed based on what the engine finds from querying the endpoints

created_at.description: Date the metadata record was created in engine (first seen on source)

updated_at.description: Date the metadata was last updated

FeedSyncResult.description: The result of a sync of a single feed

feed.description: The name of the feed synced

status.description: The result of the sync operations, either co

total_time_seconds.description: The duratin, in seconds, of the sync of the feed, the sum of all the group syncs

FeedSyncResults.description: An array of feed sync summaries representing the result of an explicit feed sync operation

FileContentSearchResult.description: The retrieved file entry including content (b64 encoded)

GateSpec.description: A description of the set of gates available in this engine and the triggers and parameters supported

name.description: Gate name, as it would appear in a policy document

state.description: State of the gate and transitively all triggers it contains if not 'active'

superceded_by.description: The name of another trigger that supercedes this on functionally if this is deprecated

triggers.description: List of the triggers that can fire for this Gate

total_time_seconds.description: The duration of the group sync in seconds

updated_image_count.description: The number of images updated by the this group sync, across all accounts. This is typically only non-zero for vulnerability feeds which update images' vulnerability results during the sync.

updated_record_count.description: The number of feed data records synced down as either updates or new records

ImageAnalysisReferences.description: List of image digests to archive

ImageAnalysisReport.description: Analysis report json to be imported

ImageAnalysisRequest.description: A request to add an image to be watched and analyzed by the engine. Optionally include the dockerfile content. Either source, digest or tag must be present.

annotations.description: Annotations to be associated with the added image in key/value form

created_at.description: Optional override of the image creation time, only honored when both tag and digest are also supplied  e.g. 2018-10-17T18:14:00Z. Deprecated in favor of the 'source' field

digest.description: A digest string for an image, maybe a pull string or just a digest. e.g. nginx@sha256:123 or sha256:abc123. If a pull string, it must have same regisry/repo as the tag field. Deprecated in favor of the 'source' field

dockerfile.description: Base64 encoded content of the dockerfile for the image, if available. Deprecated in favor of the 'source' field.

image_type.description: Optional. The type of image this is adding, defaults to "docker". This can be ommitted until multiple image types are supported.

tag.description: Full pullable tag reference for image. e.g. docker.io/nginx:latest. Deprecated in favor of the 'source' field

ImageContent.description: A metadata content record for a specific image, containing different content type entries

ImageDetail.description: A metadata detail record for a specific image. Multiple detail records may map a single catalog image.

fulldigest.description: Full docker-pullable digest string including the registry url and repository necessary get the image

fulltag.description: Full docker-pullable tag string referencing the image

imageDigest.description: The parent Anchore Image record to which this detail maps

ImageFilter.description: Filter for an image list by id, tag, or digest, but not both

ImageReference.description: A summary of an image identity, including digest, id (if available), and any tags known to have ever been mapped to the digest

analyzed_at.description: Timestamp, in rfc3339 format, indicating when the image state became 'analyzed' in Anchore Engine.

ImageSelector.description: A set of selection criteria to match an image by a tagged pullstring based on its components, with regex support in each field

registry.description: The registry section of a pull string. e.g. with "docker.io/anchore/anchore-engine:latest", this is "docker.io"

repository.description: The repository section of a pull string. e.g. with "docker.io/anchore/anchore-engine:latest", this is "anchore/anchore-engine"

tag.description: The tag-only section of a pull string. e.g. with "docker.io/anchore/anchore-engine:latest", this is "latest"

ImageSource.description: A set of analysis source types. Only one may be set in any given request.

ImageWithPackages.description: An image record that contains packages

MalwareScan.description: A single scan from a scanner

enabled.description: Indicates if the scanner is enabled

path.description: A path for a file in the image's rootfs

signature.description: The malware signature found at the path

metadata.description: Open schema for scanner-specific metadata related to the scan result

scanner.description: The name of the scanner that produced the finding

policy_id.description: Optional single policy to evalute, if set will override any value in policy_ids, for backwards compatibility. Generally, policy_ids should be used even with a array of length 1.

policy_ids.description: List of policyIds to evaluate in order, to completion

MetadataResponse.description: Generic wrapper for metadata listings from images

NotificationBase.description: base object for Notifications (every notification has this basic structure)

PackageReference.description: A record of a software item which is vulnerable or carries a fix for a vulnerability

type.description: Package type (e.g. package, rpm, deb, apk, jar, npm, gem, ...)

version.description: A version for the package. If null, then references all versions

PaginatedImageList.description: Pagination wrapped list of images that match some filter

vulnerabilities.description: The listing of matching vulnerabilities for the query subject to pagination

PaginatedVulnerabilityList.description: A paginated listing of vulnerability records sorted by ID in descending order

PaginatedVulnerableImageList.description: Pagination wrapped list of images with vulnerabilties that match some filter

PaginationProperties.description: Properties for common pagination handling to be included in any wrapping object that needs pagination elements

next_page.description: True if additional pages exist (page + 1) or False if this is the last page

page.description: The page number returned (should match the requested page query string param)

returned_count.description: The number of items sent in this response

PolicyBundle.description: A bundle containing a set of policies, whitelists, and rules for mapping them to specific images

blacklisted_images.description: List of mapping rules that define which images should always result in a STOP/FAIL policy result regardless of policy content or presence in whitelisted_images

comment.description: Description of the bundle, human readable

mappings.description: Mapping rules for defining which policy and whitelist(s) to apply to an image based on a match of the image tag or id. Evaluated in order.

name.description: Human readable name for the bundle

policies.description: Policies which define the go/stop/warn status of an image using rule matches on image properties

version.description: Version id for this bundle format

whitelisted_images.description: List of mapping rules that define which images should always be passed (unless also on the blacklist), regardless of policy result.

whitelists.description: Whitelists which define which policy matches to disregard explicitly in the final policy decision

PolicyBundleRecord.description: A policy bundle plus some metadata

active.description: True if the bundle is currently defined to be used automatically

policy_source.description: Source location of where the policy bundle originated

userId.description: UserId of the user that owns the bundle

allOf.description: The Notification Object definition for Policy Eval Notifications

PolicyRule.description: A rule that defines and decision value if the match is found true for a given image.

RegexContentMatch.description: Match of a named regex on a file

lines.description: A list of line numbers in the file that matched the regex

name.description: The name associated with the regular expression

regex.description: The regular expression used for the match

RegistryConfiguration.description: A registry entry describing the endpoint and credentials for a registry to pull images from

registry.description: hostname:port string for accessing the registry, as would be used in a docker pull operation

registry_name.description: human readable name associated with registry record

registry_user.description: Username portion of credential to use for this registry

registry_verify.description: Use TLS/SSL verification for the registry URL

userId.description: Engine user that owns this registry entry

RegistryConfigurationRequest.description: A registry record describing the endpoint and credentials for a registry

registry.description: hostname:port string for accessing the registry, as would be used in a docker pull operation. May include some or all of a repository and wildcards (e.g. docker.io/library/* or gcr.io/myproject/myrepository)

registry_name.description: human readable name associated with registry record

registry_pass.description: Password portion of credential to use for this registry

registry_user.description: Username portion of credential to use for this registry

registry_verify.description: Use TLS/SSL verification for the registry URL

RegistryDigestSource.description: An image reference using a digest in a registry, includes some extra tag and timestamp info in addition to the pull string to allow proper tag history reconstruction.

creation_timestamp_override.description: Optional override of the image creation time to support proper tag history construction in cases of out-of-order analysis compared to registry history for the tag

dockerfile.description: Base64 encoded content of the dockerfile used to build the image, if available.

tag.description: A valid docker tag reference (e.g. docker.io/nginx:latest) that will be associated with the image but not used to pull the image.

RegistryTagSource.description: An image reference using a tag in a registry, this is the most common source type.

dockerfile.description: Base64 encoded content of the dockerfile used to build the image, if available.

pullstring.description: A docker pull string (e.g. docker.io/nginx:latest, or docker.io/nginx@sha256:abd) to retrieve the image

RepositoryTagList.description: List of discovered tags in a repository

RetrievedFile.description: The retrieved file entry including content (b64 encoded)

SecretSearchResult.description: The retrieved file entry including content (b64 encoded)

base_url.description: The url to reach the service, including port as needed

hostid.description: The unique id of the host on which the service is executing

status_message.description: A state indicating the condition of the service. Normal operation is 'registered'

version.description: The version of the service as reported by the service implementation on registration

schema_version.description: Semantic version of the db schema

version.description: Semantic Version string of the service implementation

StandaloneVulnerability.description: A single vulnerability record in a single namespace, the unique key is the combination of the id and namespace

affected_packages.description: The array of packages (typically packages) that are vulnerable-to or provide fixes-for this vulnerability

description.description: Description of the vulnerability if available

id.description: Vulnerability identifier. May be CVE-X, RHSA-X, etc. Not necessarily unique across namespaces

link.description: URL for the upstream CVE record in the reporting source (e.g. ubuntu security tracker)

namespace.description: The namespace for the vulnerability record to avoid conflicts for the same id in different distros or sources (e.g. deb vs ubuntu for same CVE)

severity.description: Severity label specific to the namepsace

subscription_id.description: the unique id for this subscription record

subscription_key.description: The key value that the subscription references. E.g. a tag value or a repo name.

subscription_value.description: The value of the subscription target

userId.description: The userId of the subscribed user

SubscriptionRequest.description: A subscription entry to add to the system

SubscriptionUpdate.description: A modification to a subscription entry to change its status or value

active.description: Toggle the subscription processing on or off

subscription_value.description: The new subscription value, e.g. the new tag to be subscribed to

TagEntry.description: A docker-pullable tag value as well as deconstructed components

detected_at.description: The timestamp at which the Anchore Engine detected this tag was mapped to the image digest. Does not necessarily indicate when the tag was actually pushed to the registry.

pullstring.description: The pullable string for the tag. E.g. "docker.io/library/node:latest"

registry.description: The registry hostname:port section of the pull string

repository.description: The repository section of the pull string

tag.description: The tag-only section of the pull string

allOf.description: The Notification Object definition for Tag Update Notifications

curr_eval.description: A list containing the current image digest

last_eval.description: A list containing the previous image digests

example.description: An example value for the parameter (encoded as a string if the parameter is an object or list type)

name.description: Parameter name as it appears in policy document

required.description: Is this a required parameter or optional

superceded_by.description: The name of another trigger that supercedes this on functionally if this is deprecated

validator.description: If present, a definition for validation of input. Typically a jsonschema object that can be used to validate an input against.

TriggerSpec.description: Definition of a trigger and its parameters

parameters.description: The list of parameters that are valid for this trigger

description.description: Trigger description for what it tests and when it will fire during evaluation

name.description: Name of the trigger as it would appear in a policy document

superceded_by.description: The name of another trigger that supercedes this on functionally if this is deprecated

User.description: A username for authenticating with one or more types of credentials. User type defines the expected credentials allowed for the user. Native users have passwords, External users have no credential internally. Internal users are service/system users for inter-service communication.

created_at.description: The timestampt the user record was created

last_updated.description: The timestamp of the last update to this record

source.description: If the user is external, this is the source that the user was initialized from. All other user types have this set to null

UserCreationRequest.description: A payload for creating a new user, includes the username and password in a single request

password.description: The initial password for the user, must be at least 6 characters, up to 128

VulnDiffResult.description: The results of the comparing two vulnerability records during an update

allOf.description: The Notification Object definition for Tag Update Notifications

feed.description: The name of the feed where vulnerability match was made

feed_group.description: The name of the feed group where vulnerability match was made

fix.description: The package containing a fix, if available

package.description: The package name and version that are vulnerable in the image

package_cpe.description: The CPE string (if applicable) describing the package to vulnerability match

package_name.description: The name of the vulnerable package artifact

package_path.description: The location (if applicable) of the vulnerable package in the container filesystem

package_version.description: The version of the vulnerable package artifact

url.description: The url for more information about the vulnerability

vuln.description: The vulnerability identifier, such as CVE-2017-100, or RHSA-2017123

VulnerableImage.description: A record of an image vulnerable to some known vulnerability. Includes vulnerable package information

VulnerablePackageReference.description: A record of a software item which is vulnerable or carries a fix for a vulnerability

type.description: Package type (e.g. package, rpm, deb, apk, jar, npm, gem, ...)

version.description: A version for the package. If null, then references all versions

Whitelist.description: A collection of whitelist items to match a policy evaluation against.

WhitelistItem.description: Identifies a specific gate and trigger match from a policy against an image and indicates it should be ignored in final policy decisions

tags.description: Get and operate on the authenticated user's identity
tags.name: Identity

AsAccountParameter.description: An account name to change the resource scope of the request to that account, if permissions allow (admin only)
AsAccountParameter.name: x-anchore-account
